resources.string: Jardín is an Andean town in northwestern Colombia, known for its brightly colored houses, colorful flower displays, and sweet milk. The main square, Parque El Libertador, has rose gardens, a central fountain and the Basilica of the Immaculate Conception, neo-Gothic in style and with towers twins and view from its bell tower. The Clara Rojas Peláez House Museum offers art, antiques and a library in a colonial building.
